resources.string: Flip phone face down and work.
Time recorded when phone flipped face down/up.

1. Press the START button, which is shaped like an alarm clock. This will start a background service that monitors the device\'s sensors. Your device will continue to be monitored even if Phlip! is closed via the home or back button.
You can check that the background service is running by viewing the top of your screen: there should be a Phlip! icon in the status bar.

Swiping the navigation drawer should reveal an ongoing notification with a stop button. Pressing it will stop all monitoring. If the stop button is not visible, click the notification to load the Phlip! app and press STOP from there.

2. When the Phlip! service is running, flipping the device face up / face down will record the current time. If you flip your device face down, you have STARTED WORKING. If you flip your device back face-up, you have STOPPED WORKING.
If your device is capable of vibrating, a short vibration will occur whenever the time is recorded.
After a flip, there may be a short delay of up to 1 second before the time is recorded. This is to ensure that random shakes do not register.
Note that your STOP TIME only measures the interval between work. The app does not monitor your ongoing stop time.
3. You can check your log in the rightmost tab. Press the DELETE button in the bottom-right corner to clear the log.
4. You can check a pie chart of your work/stop time in the leftmost tab. Press the REFRESH button in the bottom-right corner to refresh the chart.
